revised_title: Morphological Studies on Equisetaceae and Psilotaceae: Development of Sporangia and Synangia
tldr: The author investigates the morphology of spore-producing members in Equisetaceae and Psilotaceae, focusing on the development of sporangia and synangia. The study reveals similarities in the origin and structure of these structures, supporting the idea that both families share a common ancestry and that their spore-producing organs have evolved from a simple Lycopodinous type.
